lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's been a while! So long since Matthew Mercer ran Dungeons & Dragons!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been a nice break.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That chair has been violated by more than a few people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can smell it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They told me to wear pants.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The very onion musk you got from that end of the table. I miss it; I do! I'm excited for the new campaign and the new year. I've been working really hard on that world. I hope you guys are excited, too. We'll have information about that first game soon. But tonight, we're excited because we get to have the fantastic Jennifer Hale join us!

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I am honored and terrified. I am a virgin.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A quote, right above your head, "Honored and terrified."

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Call me HT.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: People are here to help you. You'll be good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Be stressed. Very, very stressed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It brings a whole new kind of tabletop element to the game. I've seen a bunch of it. They even had me come and sing in the trailer, so I've been tied to this--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was so fabulous, Matt!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks to be pretty cool, so definitely go check that out on December 5th. And then the expansion on December 7th!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is why I feel bad in not reading the announcements, now. That sounds like fun!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's all a surprise for us. Oh, I have an announcement! Wait, but I don't think I have it with me!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, is it this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is that! Okay. I'm ready.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And it goes with our pencil set, so you can have, you know. You can have one, Jen, if you want!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can make your own art book.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So yeah, go check it out! It's in the store now!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The third issue of Critical Role - Vox Machina: Origins comic is available. It's getting more and more intense as each issue goes along. Check it out if you haven't had a chance. It's on Comixology, digital.darkhorse.com, and wherever else you can find digital comics online. It's pretty radical. Me and Liam, who have read the scripts and given notes on the scripts for future issues, this is getting better and better as it goes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kings of the kingdom! We don't even know, but you do!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Three just came out. I just read five, and it is so baller. Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Be patient with the rest of them, Taliesin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, to rewind, that beautiful art on that book is by @NatRoze. Roze with a Z. Made that ages ago, and Laura's been in love with it for ages.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And by the way, it's the Feywild!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm very excited. I was not aware this was coming down the pipe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, and it's shiny. I don't know if you can see it, but there's a little shimmer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thanks to the art book, I know what this is called. It's called spot gloss. Thanks to the art book, I know it's got a spot gloss cover.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is one shiny bear ass.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can rub it for luck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you're so inclined.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you are all here tonight to witness somebody in a very, completely honest way, shout excitedly, "And it's in the Feywild!" And I love that that is a thing that happened. Couple other quick announcements so we can get into the game. I will be at Paradise City Comic Con in Miami, January 12th to 14th. All of you folks out there, east coast Florida. I'm visiting my old stomping grounds where I originally grew up. Check me out there. Also, later in 2018, I'll be at Otafest in Calgary, May 18th to 20th, and A-Kon in Texas, June 7th through the 10th. Early announcement for those dates, but that way if you want to come and say hi, you can mark it in your calendar.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're at SacAnime, January 5th or 6th or something. It's the first week of January. We hated missing when Sam and Liam went.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We love SacAnime. It's great.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I got to hang with you guys at SacAnime a few years ago. We did an interview. It was so fun!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We tried to get you to talk about killing your friends and you would not do it. Why won't you kill your friends? What's the matter with you?

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Tonight I will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you're supposed to collaborate, but we'll see how it goes. Did a new episode of Madness go up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: New episode of Madness came out! We have this guy to show. Oh! This is the shirt for Sagas of Sundry: Madness. I am a Jenga pro! If you want to learn how to play Jenga, you must watch Sagas of Sundry: Madness. This eye glows in the fucking dark.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Let me see!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I like the idea that the Jenga catchphrase from Critical Role was preparation for you to actually be a Jenga master.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I surprise myself, let me tell you!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We loved our Dread shirts and were like, it's a shame they don't glow! And they were like, next time. And we're like, man!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think this is Ivan van Norman's eye. I hope it's his eye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks about right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's the door of the house, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back. So, as we bring ourselves into this story-- I missed you guys.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: It's their fault!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Although the patchwork sources leave your gear somewhat mismatched in color and make. Bundle, you in particular seem to take pride in your lime-green robes that you were assured carried a powerful enchantment.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's from a boutique!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your troupe has now found your way to the valley of the Red Ridge Mountains seeking solid work, only to find the work boards empty and the wild beasts that roam the surrounding landscape well in the hands of the local guard. You all sit within the Lakeshire Inn, within the village of Lakeshire, two cups into your woes as you lament your life choices and clashing attire. The warm interior is rather vacant outside of your band, the hearth empty with naught but a smoldering log to combat the chill morning air. That's right, you're two cups in

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure is chilly in this place, huh? Woo! Maybe you can add another log, there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Over here, in the fireplace?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, in that hearth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll throw one on. Okay."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let me know if you want another round."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is a little weak. Do you have anything stronger than this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can go look, but I got to do the log thing first."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Log, then grog, yes?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you have a menu of breakfast beers, that would be most gracious.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right." He looks a bit scattered but goes off to put the log in the hearth. So, as we go around the table, if you wouldn't mind taking a moment to describe your character as you appear at the table.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keeper of virtues and righteousness. I am devilishly handsome, and I don't play well with others because of that devilish handsomeness. But my skills are always for sale and my fellows seem to appreciate my roguish good looks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You are quite handsome. Oh, hi! My name is Greldamine Clypsol. I'm a gnome mage. I am short, even for a gnome; I know. That's fine. I wear my hair in a high bun. It's brown. I'm just the biggest fan of Jaina Proudmore. I think she's just the most amazing mage I've ever seen, you know. I hear good things about her. She's so powerful and beautiful. Sounds amazing, I hear. I don't know, I haven't met her in person.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have to catch my breath. Okay. My name is Bundle. I'm a dwarf. I've got a very, very nice lime green robe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's beautiful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Learning my trade, perfecting it. I'm a bit behind. I mean, I've got some younger brothers that are doing much better than I am, and certainly they're succeeding more and going further, and that's fine. I'm doing my best. I'm taking my own pace. Going a bit bald and I'm trying to do my best to bring it over, and it's going into a-- it's not a great beard, but I use the ham hocks to liven it up a bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's good. No, it frames your face very well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I feel like I'm making my way at my own pace very well. More beer.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No reason to spend all that time by yourself.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, my name is Quazirat Toluus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Quazirat

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Quazirat

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All ten of them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Every day of my life for the glory of Argus. I also like to sample the fine spirits of the realm, and I am a big player of MMORPGs. I like to unwind at night when I am done killing the Burning Legion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's your handle?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is LRJenkins1234.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Creative. I like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, the bartender comes by this time with the next round of drinks. The one log he placed in there is starting to catch a little bit, but it's cold enough in the morning where it's taken a little while. The smoke's billowing up, bit of it dribbling past the top of the fireplace and hitting, what you can see, is a casual stain of gray that reaches the roof of the interior of the tavern above it. As he sets it down, he goes, "I'm sorry, I didn't mean to eavesdrop. But based "on your conversation and attire, I can see that you seem to be aspiring problem solvers. Is that "right?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I guess so, that

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I suppose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see this inn, it's been in my family for "generations, left to me by my late father. And while it does keep me busy," and he looks around to a very empty tavern around you, "extremely busy, my passions lie elsewhere. My hobby, my greatest "of loves, is being a smear monger."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A smear monger."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That sounds great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A smear monger, a chandler, crafter of light."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A candlemaker!"

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What kind of candles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, all kinds of candles: scented, colorful, sizes, long wicks, short wicks."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Explosive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, but I haven't dabbled, either."

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Any black ones?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: anyway." And you can see his eyes begin to well up a bit and his hands are shaking. "I went to go to my storage shed after buying a small homestead in "Goldshire and hoping to open a shop at some point in the future. It's all gone. All of it! Just "gone! Every. Single. Candle I've made! Gone!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Even your fat stores?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And I could probably muster some armor that matches."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That'd be great!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What do you say?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have robes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That could be arranged."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Doesn't have to match.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but we should present a united front, though. I mean, people should be able to see that we are a group.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: As long as it's black.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As long as it's white.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As long as it's lime green.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm partial to purple.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll have to send away, possibly to Westfall. They "have some good dyers there. But if you agree to this, then the sooner we can get off the better!" And he twirls his mustache with both of his fingers, a nervous tick or an exclamation of physicality. "Shall we?"

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I'll agree as long as you never do that again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There was a fisherman who did like 25 of those little red plants, but this sounds better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This sounds fun! Wental, you can count on us! I jump on top of the table and raise my fist into the air.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I shrink into my chair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He awkwardly reaches out and side fistbumps, not sure what to do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Candles!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I like her!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sure this morning's fare will be also a part of our arrangement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sure."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I was going to ask for a couple bottles of your best vintage to be added to the agreed upon price.

lines.name: TRAVIS, JENNIFER
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. I'll be happy to place it upon your tab that will be wiped clean upon the "retrieval of my candles."

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: A steed or two. I saw something out back that looked rather suitable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll see what I can do. I only have so much I can do in the town, but let me try. Anyway." And he rushes off. He comes back and he brings you two bottles of wine, not the greatest. You don't get a lot of decent import over here on Lakeshore, unfortunately. It's a little out of the way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Will it mess me up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you were to chug it now, most likely!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a deal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All righty. Follow me. I'll take you to the shed. See if you can learn anything."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But to be honest, the stable master and me don't "really get along."

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Just show me where he is. I'm sure we can work something out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. Should I take you to the shed first, or do you need your steed now?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe to the shed since it's close.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: We can go to the shed. I don't want to make the small one run.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't mind. All right." And you see he seems to have confidence around the gnome. And then he gets really sheepish in the gaze of the night elf who stares down and probably stands a good six inches taller than him. So he leads you up past this section to the base of the mountains and you can see there's a really nice-looking shed that's settled between the edge of the mountains and a tree over there. It's closed, it's locked up, there's chains. But as you walk up, you can see that the actual lock has been broken and the chains dangle off to the sides of the two doors that open up into it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's your trouble. You left it unlocked.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think someone broke the lock.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a lot to just assume, just taking your first look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (squeak) He opens the front doors to the shed and upon looking inside, you can see there are shelves arranged. There are small crates that have been pried open. Across the entirety of the floor you see scraps of wax scattered here and there, large spaces where apparently clusters of it were set and have since been pulled. And it is entirely empty and scraped of any possible remainder of wax. And there's a sudden smell that comes out, too. It could be a combination of either rotting animal bits and/or some element of fecal matter. It's hard to really pick out. But it's not a pleasant interior.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are there any markings, footprints, different toe patterns, any kind of clues?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So if you want to have a look, please!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I was actually asking the DM.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I see, with my Draenei eyes, as I stroke my chin tentacles--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have tentacles?! You have tentacles on your chin?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On my chin. I don't like to draw attention to them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't need to. They're just there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So are you getting to the ground?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. I'm making an investigation check. I'm rolling a d20. That's not very good. That is, hold on! I've just solved the entire game. That's a two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get close to the ground and there's a lot of small bits of wax. And you start pulling them together and piecing them, and you figure if you spend the next couple hours, you can maybe put together a very small candle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There were candles here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are correct.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Quazi, you are astute, as always. Bundle, would you mind checking the lock to see if there's--?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I take a look at the lock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, boy. Oh, wow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, no. It's cold in here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Warm it up, guys!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seven?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven? The lock appears to have been broken through blunt force, but you have no other information you can draw from it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Lock appears to have been broken by blunt force. I don't know.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Let me have a look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, if you want to go ahead and make an investigation check as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a good idea. Okay, that's better than us. So you go from there to there, and add that.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: So it's 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it looks almost like there's also a toe or two protruding from the front. Smaller than a man's feet. They lead away from the shed and then further up the mountain range to the westward direction.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: It's my first game!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can also tell there were candles here, yes?

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Yes. I can smell there were candles here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, go ahead and roll a d20 and add your intelligence modifier to this one. So, look at your intelligence. Liam, want to help her with the intelligence modifier?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Intelligence modifier is up here, yeah? Five plus--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, so intelligence check, you say? Intelligence check? Well, then it's just that plus-- where the hell is it? There it is.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Ten!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten? Okay. You recall seeing tracks like this before but the name is on the tip of your tongue. You're not entirely certain what it could be.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: The name's on the tip of my tongue and I can't quite grab it. Can someone else grab it for me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. Let me see if I recognize these tracks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does anyone know that you make candles? Other than your father?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, he doesn't know yet. I was going to open the store first and have him come take a look "at it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay. So you don't have any candle enemies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't believe so. Not in this town. There isn't a candlemaker, not anymore."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And are your candles scented?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Some of them were."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do most of them smell like animal fat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, they do, by their very nature. But I try best to add lavender to the batch and "occasionally--"

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Lavender, you say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, lavender."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about paht-pourri?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've discussed this. It's

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're dropping off the T.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, it's just potpourri.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're fucking with me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, for the fourth time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Were you going to track them?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd like to try.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a survival check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that with your Grog dice?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With my die!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as the armored human paladin gets low. His eyes suddenly spark! As he looks to the left, looks to the right, looks down to the ground, and, almost like a hound dog, begins trailing this track curving around the shed into the west as you guys slowly follow suit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is why we pay him big gold bucks right there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And because I'm handsome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys follow, Wental stays a few steps behind. He seems excited, but also not sure what you guys are going to discover and you can see the tension rising in him. His shoulders are slowly creeping up across the sides of his head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, we're clearly much more experienced fighters than you are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're dry. It's a small bramble cluster. It's about five or so feet up. It's a wide chunk and you can see bits and pieces of it scattered across the edge of the mountain range here. As you get closer you can see some of the jagged edges of the boosh have a faint-- A boosh. The boosh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you amused by the boosh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find the boosh rather amusing. On the jagged edges of the bush you see faint elements of a waxy residue that have been scraped onto some of the thorns of the brambles.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Probably unrelated.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just beyond you can barely see a dark recess, about four feet tall and about four feet wide, behind the bush, that presses into the mountain range.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The tracks lead to this bush. If you see just beyond there's a recess in the mountains.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How big is the recess?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's like four-- what is it? How far about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four foot wide and four foot tall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. That's small for a human.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Indeed it is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I wonder if these creatures who stole the candles are smaller than humans.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My hypothesis exactly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or they're prone to crawling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, or that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They could be crawlers. That's some mean crawlers.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Gren-- Grel-- Greldamin?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: It looks like you could stand upright in that hole.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Yes. It's another element we should factor into our search.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I go in? Should we all go in?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You first, little one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gladly. Can we move these thorny bushes out of the way though?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Absolutely. I start ripping the dried brush out of the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The brush is actually not attached to the ground. It comes and pulls out of the way really easily.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Does he fall on his butt when he pulls on it that hard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He almost does. He teeters on one foot as his sheer show of strength to tear them out overcompensates and his armored self, being top heavy as he is, he stands there and awkwardly wobbles in place. And for a moment you see as the bartender, Wental, swallows deeply out of the choice of companions that he's hired for this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wental, are you coming with us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh goodness no!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you sure? We have extra daggers and all sorts of things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have a job. It's busy. Lot of people in there. I need to make drinks and breakfast. I "hired you to do this for me. Please do this for me."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course, yes, don't worry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We will take care of this and be back expediently. You can count on us!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Wonderful, thank you."

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Please have dinner ready.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes ma'am." You can't tell if he's crushing or legitimately super frightened but, "Good "luck!"

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: One and the same.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So pulling the brush out of the way, you can see this has been a deliberately-dug cavern that recedes into the mountain and into darkness.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hello!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (imitates echo) It does echo a bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can you see in the dark?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, but I also have Light! And I send Light down the tunnel. Can I do that? Can I send Light down the tunnel or does it light up around me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you choose an object to then light up like it was a torch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, what do we have on us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a torch. I have ten of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Well we should probably just use a torch then.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's also rocks on the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! I'll pick up a rock and cast Light on the rock! That was a good idea, Whatever-Your-Toes!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. Is there room for our World of Warcraft pauldrons to go into this space?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four foot wide? At your size? Barely. It scrapes the edges as you push inward, digging two small grooves along the cavern.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Let's send him first. Someone push him from behind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Grease it up and he'll squeeze right in there.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: There's candle wax around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wax the corners and push him through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Either the small magic one or the sneaky one should be going first, I think, yes?

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Well she can stand upright.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll go first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right little stinker, let's see what you can do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Greldamine, as you light up the rock in your hand and it's giving off this bright torch light, you hold it in front of you and you walk right into it. As soon as you begin to step into the chamber you can already feel there's a faint cold breeze blowing from the open world behind you into the chamber. You're drawn deeper and deeper into the darkness within as it begins to faintly grade into a descent. What's the order in which you guys are traveling behind her?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh jeez, this is so dumb that I'm in the front.

lines.name: MATT, LAURA
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With my 37 hit points.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're so squishy!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're all a little squishy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To make you feel better I will be second.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll go right in the middle.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: If you'd like a wall behind us, I'll go after him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Dramamine, lead the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your feet slip and slick against the soft floor as you occasionally have to right yourself against the walls of the cavern, being careful as you push deeper into this. Now after some time the path comes to an abrupt halt where the floor seems to drop down about five feet into a tunnel that opens larger and wider, 15 feet below you, deeper still into the mountain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shh! Can I hear anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh! 23.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What little bit of wind is passing through down into the cavern, you can hear what sounds like a faint rock falling. Some scraping sounds and a door slam, distant, below you, and distant.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Might this be a good time for some shadow melding?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's up to you. You can only use it once per short rest so keep that in mind. If there's nothing currently around you can still stealth whenever you want to.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I'm inclined to stealth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah, you can stealth.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I'm inclined to stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so yeah, go ahead and roll a stealth check.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I'll be the stealth person. All right so--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can all try to stealth right now if you want to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It would be better because here's the thing, even if you are supremely sneaky which you are, I'm fucking bullshit with sneaking so we all have to, you know, pull our weight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you'll roll a 20.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll see how I do. Three!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your darker night elf complexion vanishes into the shadows-- there you go. I love it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 13 as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I lied. Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That makes a difference. All right so, as you guys all quietly look down into this small cavern it drops down, you're looking over the edge--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like five feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like five, six feet down below you jump down if you want to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we jump down?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah! They'll never see us coming! (shushing)

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Put a sock in it. So I suppose I should go ahead. I'm going to sneak ahead because I'm the sneaky one in this one. All right, I'm sneaking ahead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys all leap down into the tunnel below you--

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Oh, oh! (grunt)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go ahead and begin to sneak ahead a bit and it switches back a bit and goes into a much more steady decline in the direction of where you came from below.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Is it slippery?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's actually much drier now. You're further away from the cavern entrance, it looks like the water--

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: It's much drier here. I'm going ahead. I smell something. It's very familiar, but my intelligence is not as high as I'd like so I can't remember what it is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Lavender.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: It smells like lavender. It does, good reminder.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't smell lavender as well--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No? Never mind, that's just me being a nuisance.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I don't smell lavender, I take that back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you--

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Stop it, I'm new.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do begin to hear as you begin your approach what sounds like faint rushing water.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I hear rushing water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you see ahead as you're pushing forward-- are you guys following behind her?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, no, we're following, we're following.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So like, hanging about 20 feet or so back?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually the path begins to curve to the left and you can see a faint source of light that begins to emerge around the corner as you begin to curve around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) What does it look like?

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: (whispering) It looks like a long thin ray of light. Vertical, I think. I've been waiting to find out if I'm right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you making this up?

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I am, totally. Am I allowed? Am I allowed to do that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Oh, I'll stop now. I don't know this game yet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What happens is he will create the environment and the things around you and you interact with them and you roll dice occasionally.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I'm going to go under here for a minute.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're in control of your personality and the actions you do in this world. He's the world.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I don't know, do I see any light?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you coast around the corner go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There it is. Oh that's shnazzy. Yeah. What is that?

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: (counting) 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two rickety wood plank bridges that cross past it are attached and nailed into portions of the rock, and then right across, you can see the source of light. There's a number of sources of light that are slightly shifting on the opposite end of the chamber. There's another platform on the other end of the river where you can see roughly nine nasty looking humanoid creatures that are clustered with patches of fur on portions of their body. They carry satchels and packs. A single, melting lit candle rests atop each of their heads as their light source in these dark tunnels.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's really cute.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You now recognize what was on the tip of your tongue. These are definitely kobolds and they appear to have been coming through a door that is now closed and being locked on the opposite side by one of them that is larger. They're carrying these large sacks and they're all talking amongst each other. You can see their features are somewhat rat-like and their protruded snouts, whiskers that shoot off to each side. They haven't noticed your presence yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How tall are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About three and a half, four feet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So they're taller than I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I put my rock out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so your light source vanishes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And we've been trailing the elf, so--

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Now we're in the clear, so I'm going to step back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What should we do? How many of them are there?

lines.name: TALIESIN, JENNIFER
lines.text: (counting) One, two, three, four.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nine? There's about nine of them. Okay. Do you think we could take nine of them?

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Has anybody tried talking to kobolds before?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I haven't.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've never talked to one before.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: If our mission is to bring the candles home, what would happen to the candles if we took them out in a violent manner? Would they be damaged, would that--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did we ask how many candles were missing? Boxes of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: An entire shed's worth!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think it was more than nine so like ten candles. Eleven, probably. We'll find out if we kill them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder if these are actual candles or if these are old candles and they stole his candles for new candles because the candles on their head are wearing down, do you know what I mean?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You just said candles a lot of times.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who's feeling particularly sneaky right now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can be invisible.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right. Feel like journeying in a little bit? Seeing what else you can see?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure. Sure! I cast Invisibility on myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You watch as the outside of your gnomish companion shimmers and then vanishes. You find yourself invisible and you step carefully.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to walk across the bridge now.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: We can still hear you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I'll be quiet once I get

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: See if you can see any of the other candles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I walk towards one of the rickety bridges.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make a stealth check with advantage because you're invisible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh. Yeah. 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, natural 20! Ha!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you can hear faintly what he's instructing is, "Stop complaining. We've gots to "get these tunnels boom-booming before more cursed people come. Now you, place there, you place "there, me, I place everywhere else." And they all begin to scatter a bit and make their way towards the two bridges to begin to cross over in the direction of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! Oh god, and I start backing up towards my companions. I run towards them and say They're on their way over here! They're going to blow things up! I think the big one has the bag of candles on his back!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You sure you heard

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, he said something about blowing things up!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where are you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm right here! I punch him in the knee. I could've punched something else.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've got to stop them. There's nine of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can do it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's five of us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we take out one of the bridges while they're on the bridge?! Cut the rope and then some of them that are on the bridge will fall!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While you're having this conversation two of them have just now finished traversing the bridge.

lines.name: LAURA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Quick! Go cut the bridge!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Go cut the bridge?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cut the rope on the bridge!

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Can I take them out while--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you'd like to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is the time.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: This is the time to take them out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as they're having this conversation you pull around the corner with your hand crossbow and make a shot at the closest one to you. You see one of the kobolds lumbering up, he's reaching into his satchel and he's pulling out a small rod of some kind. Go ahead and roll an attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. And it's at advantage because she's hiding, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, so roll it twice and take the higher one. So it's a 17 plus your attack from the crossbow is a 25.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: 26. 17 plus nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh that most definitely hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That most definitely hits. So go ahead and roll damage on that with sneak attack damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So the damage is a 1d6, so you roll one of those cubes.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: One?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, three plus your sneak attack damage which is at your level--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably 1d6. 2d6 maybe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's 4d6. It's under the attack.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: There it is. 4d6.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 4d6?! What level are we?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Level seven.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: So I add ten. 17.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus the five.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: So 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 points of damage. So, as that one crosses the way it pulls out its rod and (grunting) (arrow whooshing) (cry of pain) and goes straight down, limp, drunk ET style, on the ground, slams face first and is done.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: We need to get the other one now don't we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, the one that just finished crossing the bridge on the other side goes "Cera! "Get up!" Walks over and kicks him. Then looks over and sees you holding the hand crossbow and goes (screaming).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I have time to get one attack in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: What's initiative?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So we're seeing what the order is so roll 20 again and add this. And then keep that number in your head. For a moment. You changed it, roll it again.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I saw what it was but--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well if you know what it was then keep it.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I do know what--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can't read your die Jen! Yes, that's good, that's 23. Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just remember that. Why can't I roll well? Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right so we have 23, we have-- how do you spell your character's name again?

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: A-E-R-W-Y-N but it's I-N, either one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Aerwin? Okay cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: J-E-L-L-O.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Perfect.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it's 20 to 15? Anybody?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She had 23 right?

lines.name: MATT, JENNIFER
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, what was it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. And spell your name for me real fast.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: L-O-H-K-O-R.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lohkor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 to ten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lies. 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty and then--?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 11. Quazirat.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Quasimodo.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Q-U-A-Z-I.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm naming you Toes, because that's all I can remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, cool. So top of the round as all the kobolds now notice you guys clustered right there at the entrance of the cavern, start rushing over the bridge, their pickaxes out and the larger one on the opposite side, seeing this, seems to be preparing for something. What are you doing?

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I'm loading up the crossbow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you pull out another bolt, load it up and staying there, and you're going to fire at which one?

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: They're all behind the one in the front?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's the one that just kicked the guy you killed and there's two sets that are running across the bridges currently over the water.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I'm going for their leader.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay cool, so you might have to get a little closer, you're about 40 feet away from him or you can fire from now but you'll have disadvantage on the attack. But up to you.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I can move a little closer. I'll move, hit and then move, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I can do that can't I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can do that, yeah. So you go ahead and move forward your 30 feet, that'll get you into a 30 foot range. You'll be almost in melee range with one of the kobolds. Go ahead and take a shot at the leader.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: And that's these? No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To hit you roll d20. So roll the roundy and add your attack bonus for crossbow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 just hits. So you roll damage, it's not sneak attack because you're not hidden.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, so now you're just rolling d6, a cube.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: d6 cube. Which one's the d6? It's this one! Okay, there we go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And add a five.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can use your bonus action to dash backward if you'd like to back into the cavern entrance.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Yes, I think that's most useful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay so, after firing the kobolds are rushing in and you back up, getting behind your allies to protect you. All right, that brings it to Lohkor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know why we always try and do this stealthily. I get the warhammer out and I'll reach forward to the one and take a big swing right in his face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. This is the one who kicked his friend trying to wake him up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's 1d8. 13 points of bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 points of bludgeoning damage. All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have another one because of extra attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice! 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice. And that is seven points of bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you rush forward the first hit hits him upside the chin. You see a spatter of blood across the rock behind you. He gets back and pulls out his pickaxe, his angry whiskered face, you see fury in his eyes and you sink the hammer into his face. He's like (cry of pain) (gurgle) and he falls to the ground, dead.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! I turn to the rest of them and I say: Let them have it! And I take off running into the fray.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, great. As that's happening, you running, the larger leader in the back who finishes fiddling with his pack pulls a small rod, holds it up to the top of the candle on his head and you watch it spark, and lobs it in an arc over to where you are. The kobolds stop running and watch it going as it arcs over, except for two of them that weren't paying attention and are charging towards you as it (thudding) between your legs, rolls a little behind you, and there's that brief moment where everything slows down for but an instance before it explodes in a cacophonous explosion of flame and force. I need all of you to make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: So that's the d20?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So yeah, roll d20. Dexterity save. So what you get on that? Ten plus that is here. Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right so, what did you get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that succeeds.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Succeeds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just barely succeeds.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And this is a save, not ability skill, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, that's big 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a failure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. I don't think so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right so, Bundle and Quazirat, you guys both suffer 18 points of fire damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Seems fake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bundle, your turn.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everything hurts, one second. I'm finding a thing--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: New class abilities. We're all like, flexing in the thing that we've never played before.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know, this is so difficult.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: At least I'm not the only one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to quickly cast Mass Healing Word on everybody while I, not even get up, I'm going to sit up and cast Mass Healing Word on the group.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so go ahead and roll that. That's a d4 plus your--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's right it's auto. So, d4 plus wisdom modifier. That's six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so everyone heals six hit points.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I'm going to use my bonus action to create a Spiritual Weapon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What kind of weapon is it taking the form of?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A giant hammer that looks a little bit like an anvil that's bigger than his hammer. It's going to manifest right above the main kobold's head ten feet up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as it begins to apparate in the sky, Lohkor, you look across and you can see the hammer, slightly larger than your hammer, apparate.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Son of a Bundle!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does take a swing at the leader, so go for it. I believe when you summon, it gets to take one hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it get to take one hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Double-check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I'll go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Spiritual Weapon. Yep!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Leaps backward as it slams into the ground, cracking the stone beneath and he dodges out of the way. (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Still with the performance issues, eh, Bundle?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm getting up! And I use my movement to stand up and shake off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, cool. Ending Bundle's turn, that'll bring us to Grendlemine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, it's Greldamine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Greldamine, sorry! Reading my own handwriting's a problem.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are any of them in a line? Are they on the bridge still?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the bridge there's three on each bridge that are in a line.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then the big one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, no, at this point, there's two, because two of them got blown away. There's two on each bridge right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, and the big one, is he lined up with a bridge, or is he between the bridges?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he's in between the two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On other side.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Is Greldamine still invisible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She is currently.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's the length of those bridge, guesstimation-wise?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The bridges are about 20 feet across, 15 to 20. They're not super long bridges; it's not a huge chamber.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: How many of them are left now? We were down to eight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Five total: two on each bridge, big guy other side. Big is relative term.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. For fear of damaging the perhaps bag of candles on the big one's back, that would be bad, I'm going to cast Burning Hands towards one of the bridges with two of the things on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! So you rush forward as two of the surviving kobolds-- on the right or the left bridge?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The left!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you run over to the left bridge and, as the kobolds are rushing across with their pickaxes out (heavy breathing), you--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (screams)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as her invisible form suddenly appears, apparating as the illusion that has been hiding her vanishes. As a flamethrower gout of fire burns out from in front, engulfing both of the kobolds. What's the saving throw on that? What's your DC? Your spell DC?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My DC is 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16! No! Yes! One of them succeeds, one of them fails.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, what's the damage on that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 3d6 fire damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So go ahead and roll 3d6.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And it sets things on fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. The bridge is definitely on fire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nine damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, nine damage. Then one of them takes four damage. Okay, so they're like, "Ugh!" They pull back a bit, and you can see the edge of their whiskers are curling in and burned. The fur's seared at the edges. Some of them actually have caught fire and a little bit of smoke is pouring off. But the edge of the bridge that they're standing on, that you're right in front of, has definitely caught fire. And you can see the two kobolds are now trying to figure out what to do as they're stuck in the middle right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to run away from the bridge and hide behind Lohkor's legs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You used your movement to approach the bridge to cast Burning Hands.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I did? Great! Can I move at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll give you five feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll back up five feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (small steps). Their eyes are trained on

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that ends your turn. That brings it to their turn. So, as far as kobolds go, the two that are on the bridge start rushing towards you. I'm going to go ahead and see if the bridge maintains its coherence for both of them. For the first one it's fine. The second one it is not. So the first kobold runs forward and it's going to swing at you with its pickaxe. Because you were damaged by another kobold, it gets a bonus to damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was? Oh, I was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From the explosion earlier. So, that is going to be a 20 to hit?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe that hits, right?

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and you suffer ten points of piercing damage as the pickaxe hacks into your shoulder as it rushes past. The other one, as it's running towards you, you see it pulling back its pickaxe to follow through and try and attack with its friend as the final ropes release. And you watch him go (yells) and vanish into the water below. You hear him (gurgles) as he gets carried by the water current further down the river and he's trying to swim upstream. He's currently stuck in the middle of trying to figure out what to do there. The other two rush across the other side of the chamber, finish traversing that bridge, and go straight towards you, Lohkor, because you're the closest to them at this point. That's going to be a 17 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other one's going to go ahead and instead he's going to-- That's a 22 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That does hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you go ahead and suffer six points of piercing damage. The first one you deflect, the second one hits you, jamming into one of the plates, bending the armor, and hitting you in the side. You feel your body tense from the severe pain. But it's nothing, you've had worse.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Just not the face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Quazirat, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there a clear path between where I'm standing and either bridge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'd have to take an attack of opportunity from both of them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that sounds fun. I'm going to run for edge of bridge on this side. How far is that for me where I'm starting?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say it's about 15 feet from you now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's good. I like it. 15 feet is good. I run towards edge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you run to the edge. You go past the two kobolds. Are you just running past them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, they both get attacks of opportunity on you. The first one is-- Wow, the golden snitch is working for me now. That is 21 to hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure, that hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is seven points of piercing damage as the pickaxe swings and snags you in the back of the shoulder blade. The other one is a 17 to hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, eat shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That one scrapes across the back of your armor and makes no effective impact. You continue rushing across the bridge--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. I used 15 feet to get here. I'm going to do my running long jump for 25 feet over 20 foot bridge you describe to me and land on other side. And move up to this asshole on other side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You cannot jump further than your movement speed, technically. So you run, you jump, and you're getting right towards the edge there. I would like you to go ahead and make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, you think I would understand this mechanic before this moment in my life at level seven. What kind of check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be an acrobatics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Oh, not great at all. But I get to add two because of Remarkable Athlete, so hopefully that's enough. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. You were prepared. You make your way through the air, barely catch the edge of where the other platform begins, and you roll over the shoulder into it. And as you come to stand, you're right there before the leader kobold who's there with his giant pack there ready as he has another one of these sticks that he's currently trying to pull up to the candle on his head. What are you going to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm how far from him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're right up against him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, well I'm going to take his head off. I had a pet rat but I don't care. Here we go. Oh, that's a one! But I have an extra attack, so I will go again. Oh, that's so bad! That's a 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you confidently grin, your massive draenei body looking down upon this kobold, who looks like he got caught with his hand in the cookie jar, you swing wide with-- What weapon are you using?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm using greatsword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This giant two-handed cleaver that swings, and the kobold goes (hums).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to attempt to embarrass myself further and use action surge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make two more attacks. He dodges both of your swings.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Colville, don't fuck me, Colville!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's now laughing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 15 for the one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 just misses.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But this last one is okay! 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 does hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, finally!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He dodges the third one and goes, "You have problem? Can't hit?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is ten slashing damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten slashing damage. You take a chunk out of his shoulder. "This favorite shoulder!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's get this shit started!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. Ending your turn. To the top. It is your turn, Aerwin. So there are now currently four living kobolds. Well, one of them has fallen into the river, who is currently beneath the water, struggling against the current. There is one that is partially damaged that is currently up against and fighting him. Actually, no, two of them that are up against fighting you and one that's up against you.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: But this one also--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, there's the main leader across the way that he's currently up against.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So, you attack this guy, you get sneak attack damage because I am right up against him.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Yes, I want to do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you're taking another shot with your crossbow?

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you load up another bolt. And then aiming across the way. Making your way up close to where the bridge is, you'll end up being in the melee range of the one that's fighting her, but you can still make the strike.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Acceptable risk.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: All right, so I roll a d20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll your attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What'd you get? Plus your crossbow--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 hits, go ahead and roll damage plus sneak attack damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So, 1d6 to start, then you add the other cubes. Okay, that's good.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: And then I add these guys? Okay. 18.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a bonus action if you wanted to do anything.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Well, I'm right next to the one that's attacking her, correct? I think I'll turn around with the short sword--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nope, you cannot do that with bonus. But is she up against any kobolds at the moment?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's right next to one that's been fighting her.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, the best you could do with a bonus is maybe to disengage. Which means get away from them so they cannot hurt you. But you cannot hit again with--

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Okay, I'll disengage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you for the good advice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's good advice. Just dance back a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So with the five feet of your movement left, you go ahead and step away, using your bonus action to disengage, carefully stepping from the kobold as it's going feral right now, feeling surrounded. That ends your turn. You're up, Lohkor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I am

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 will definitely hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is 12 points of bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 points of bludgeoning damage. As it comes down, the hammer slams into the chest area of one of the kobolds that's harassing you. It hits him and you hear this little squeak sound as the chest cavity takes a very heavy blow. Still standing, but it's hurt.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Still standing, eh? Round two! That is a 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That definitely hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Another 12 points of bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with that you use the momentum of pulling away to swing upward and from the underhand to hit. It snaps against the bottom of the kobold's jaw and you hear its neck (cracks) from the impact and it falls onto its back as its legs curl back into its torso. And it's done.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With my bonus action I turn and point to the last standing one: My eye sees you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And looking at his pack you can see his pack is filled. It wasn't candles in that pack. It is jam-filled with explosives. And he goes rushing past you. You get an attack of opportunity on him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh good, yes. He's got lots of candles! Yeah, that's good. That's 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Chop his head off!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm trying! It's a ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it lands, it detonates, taking out-- let's see here. Damage-wise, everybody but you needs to go ahead and roll a dexterity saving throw please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, this is bad.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, so you did quite good with 22, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 points of fire damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 just barely succeeds, so you take 12 points of fire damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I said 21, right? Sorry, so it's ten points of fire damage. 21 points of fire damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten points of fire damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does she have evasion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do, so you take nothing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Zero! Because rogue is best class.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you, seeing this coming, you jump backwards, grab the kobold that's in front, and use him to shield you from the blast. And he goes (screams) and scatters into ash as it manages to detonate and explode the remaining kobolds in the area. So all the kobolds that were with him have all fallen to the ground now, turned to ash, or detonated in some way. And you can see as the leader of them is catching his breath across the bridge, he goes, "Oh no." And he glances past with his long gaze, and you can look over at the other kobolds that had their own small caches of dynamite sticks, some of which have been lit by the recent explosion, that are rolling towards the rock wall where you guys entered.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've got to go! Double dash, all the way out!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys all start rushing towards where? Off the bridge?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Across the bridge, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're going to do this as to see who can manage to make it across before the explosion.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's going to be an early night.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's the check again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just roll initiative.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: God, why am I rolling so bad? Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You were pretty much mostly fine across the bridge. All of you go rushing past as you see Lohkor going (huffing and explosion). You see the whole room behind him light up. You can see a silhouette. It's full-on movie style explosion as you see it burn past him. You only catch the edge of it, which is good, because you then only suffer eight points of fire damage. But you watch as the entrance you guys came through falls and collapses, a series of boulders and rocks, the opposite end of the chamber falling in on itself. Part of the river, you can see the kobold that's barely clawing its way out of the water, (panting) "Huh?" (thud). A rock hits and smashes him across the bank. Part of the river fills in and you can see now the bank splashing over and starting to try to make its way back. But you guys are now on the opposite side of the chamber. It's quiet. You all take a minute to breathe, look at your wounds. You're a bit singed around the way--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm putting out the fire in my hair. I use Lay on Hands to put out the fire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I forgot to do this. And I cast Mage Armor on myself.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Before. Much better than after.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to maybe do a Prayer of Healing. Also, technically speaking, I have Disciple of Light, which means-- Would everyone have gained an extra five points?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They would've, yes. Keep that in mind. Next time. We'll say for now, you guys all would've healed an additional five points of damage because he is really good at healing as a priest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to take like five, or maybe even 20 minutes here before we go forward?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean we're hot on the trail.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why do we need to do that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know. You know, conserving energy, that kind of thing. Let's go! You want to kick ass, I can tell. Little one, let's go.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I'm with her. I will now call her Small and Brave. I'm with Small and Brave. SB for short.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can't do Prayer of Healing while we're walking though, can I? It's just verbal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is it the ten minute one? You have to sit still for ten minutes to do it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So that's 2d8 plus my spellcasting ability modifier?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's not long enough for hit dice and stuff though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So roll 2d8 plus your wisdom modifier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god, really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Double ones?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is the beginning of the end.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did he really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He tossed it at the DM.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So that's nine points of healing to everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still good. All of you guys heal nine points. That's not bad.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Okay, so we already added the five, but we don't get the five?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine on top of that.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Nine more on top of the five? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Bundle finishes the Prayer of Healing and you all feel your wounds begin to close and stitch themselves together, you see a little bit of movement at the edge of the banks. Between the rock that had plummeted into it, you watch as a tiny hand-- Climbing out of the water you see a very bloodied, smashed, one eye swollen kobold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I use Firebolt at it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No! Don't you want to ask maybe what they were doing down here, or what their plans might be?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I mean sure, if that sounds good to you!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think it might be wise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm a rage monster. I just like to kill things!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know that about you.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: That's why she's my new best friend.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I go over and pick it up by the back of the neck?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (squeals)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hello, friend. Before I let one of these fine people--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he's scrambling right now, looking up at the candle which is currently out because of the waterlogged, it's like (whimpers).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know, a very sad face. Before one of these fine people sends you to your maker, what were you doing in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay. Just, you friend, right? I work, help!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, friend. Much more work for you, friend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Reeksus."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wicksis.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Reeksus."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Reeksus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You understand what he's saying? Because I can't tell at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We sent by great King Togwaggle. Togwaggle send us to make bigger booms! Make better tunnels "to people town!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, I am aware of people town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "King Togwaggle greatest, best of all kobolds!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How are those tunnels coming? You've made them, or making them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We made and make more, by the glory of Rakanishu and King Togwaggle."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: King Togwaggle, is he here with you now, close by?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks back towards the closed door.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Back that way?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does the king have all of our candles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Lots of candles."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lots of candles. We should talk to him.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: How many people are with the king?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "People? No people."

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Sorry, how many of your kind are with the king?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "King is not very kind either, but is good king!"

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Are there many kobolds with the king?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There is a few."

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: More than there were here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Depends on the time of day."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know, we've been away for a while."

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: When do you eat? When do the kobold eat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "When there is food."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like him. Can we keep him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And what would we do with him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you have food to eat?"

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Do all the kobold eat together?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pull out some beef jerky and hand it to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (messy chewing)

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: There's more where that came from if you answer the question. Are there more than those of us you see here of the kobold?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are, but scattered. Dangerous tunnels, find dangerous things. Wander. Avoid "them! We do."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Quazi, do you think maybe you could convince him to show us safe passage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Safe passage, convince him? Oh, yes. Bring closer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (squeals) And you catch him as he throws him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your hands, what I like about them is they're so little (bones snapping).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (yelps) Make an intimidation check. With advantage for breaking his hands.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (screams and sobs)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, I can do this to you five more times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, I only have two hands!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can play this game all night long, little man. So we need to get inside. We need to be, you know, alive and not getting killed, so we would like to keep you. She has lots of beef jerky, we could feed you. But we can't have any, what did you call these?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Boom booms. Okay, I show you. I show you! Don't break! No more arms left to break."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, heal him, please? His poor hands!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well let him earn it first, you know? Maybe, 20 minutes we're still alive, you have healed hand and more meat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay. Put me down?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not holding you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, you are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You gave him to me? I like this guy. Pat pat pat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the rush of combat, you didn't realize that you were clutching him the whole time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I went like this. I thought you were holding him. You know, Dungeons & Dragons is funny thing. Your mind's different from my mind. Who knows what we're seeing? I drop his ass on ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We need to go through door."

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Should we secure him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you want.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've got rope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just so we make sure you don't break your other hand, she's going to make sure that you're secure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Do I need to roll something for that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, easy enough. He waits for you-- You have rope on you?

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: I do, I have rope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you go ahead and you bind him up and you have a little leash that you're holding him by. And he's like, "Okay. To the door."

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Can I pass her the leash since he's her pet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh. Pet?" Greldamine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're having a kobold's leash handed to you.

lines.name: JENNIFER
lines.text: Can I pass him your leash? Would you like to have him as a pet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, well, all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Broken, jagged teeth, spittle drooling down.

lines.name: LAURA
